column4: Has anyone here tried to install ubuntu on an 'ipod' as an external usb drive? Colony 4 almost worked, but I had some problems with grub.
I have installed heaps of distros on external usb drives, most often u get a kernel panic VFS unable to sync root filesystem, is that what you got? if so theres an easy fix
No.. the installer corrupted the previously installed Redhat grub configuration (hda) rather than the usb drive (sda).
How do you do that? grub; root (sda1); setup(sda) ?
Yeah... the machine that I was installing from only has USB FD option, so I couldn't test the install.
How do I go about  raising this as a possible bug?
Thanks.. I'm wandering over to 'ubuntu-devel'
what happens when you execute cfdisk
Free space 80 Gb
But /proc/partitions shows 4 partitions.. so I may be able to rebuild
you will be able to, gimme a tic
It was a 'dd' that went horribly wrong. (hda instead of sda)
Friends don't let friends drink and dd.
ha ha
It's one of my more faviourite tools.
have u seen this yet http://www.linux.com/howtos/Partition/recovering.shtml
did u take a look, perhaps gpart or TestDisk will help first, otherwise you can follow those instructions
